english: second generation; children; offspring; successor generation

etymology.description: 二(=第二) + 代(一代/世代) = second generation; successor generation.
etymology.interpretation: Refers to the second generation of a family, group, or product; often used as a suffix in compounds like 移民二代 or 富二代. Can broadly mean the offspring or successor cohort that follows the first generation.

examples.chinese: 他是艺术家的二代(他是藝術家的二代)，继承了家族的天赋(繼承了家族的天賦)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yìshùjiā de èrdài, jìchéngle jiāzú de tiānfù.
examples.english: He is the second generation of artists and has inherited the family's talent.

examples.chinese: 这家公司在二代接班后发展更快(這家公司在二代接班後發展更快)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā gōngsī zài èrdài jiēbān hòu fāzhǎn gèng kuài.
examples.english: After the second generation took over, the company grew faster.

examples.chinese: 移民二代在两种文化中成长(移民二代在兩種文化中成長)。
examples.pinyin: Yímín èrdài zài liǎng zhǒng wénhuà zhōng chéngzhǎng.
examples.english: Second-generation immigrants grow up between two cultures.
